DOC.brief_summary: Retrospective study to assess incidence and predictors of opioid abuse, addiction, overdose & death among patients prescribed ER/LA opioid products
DOC.brief_title: Incidence and Predictors of Opioid Overdose and Death in ER/LA Opioid Users as Measured by Diagnoses and Death Records
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose of this study is to quantify certain risks, and predictors of the risks, associated with the long-term use of ER/LA opioids for the treatment of chronic pain using coded terms in large health databases maintained by healthcare providers and health insurers using validated measures of these risks developed in companion studies and in parallel with a prospective, questionnaire-based cohort study of these risks.
DOC.criteria: In the primary analysis, cohort members will have had information represented in the database for at least six months, with no ER/LA opioid dispensing prior to a recorded ER/LA opioid dispensing occurring in 2006 or later. In the secondary analysis, no restriction on the duration cohort members must have had information represented in the database will be used.
